intro: Izozogia, commonly known as the "sacred fig" or "banyan tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves and the ability to produce both male and female flowers on the same plant. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid climates with well-drained soil. Its aerial roots contribute to its distinctive appearance, allowing it to form a sprawling canopy. Izozogia is also valued for its ecological role, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
